description: Number of connected regular graphs with n nodes.
references: M. Meringer, Fast Generation of Regular Graphs and Construction of Cages. Journal of Graph Theory, 30 (1999), 137-146. [From _Jason Kimberley_, Sep 23 2009]
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
P. Steinbach, Field Guide to Simple Graphs. Design Lab, Albuquerque NM, 1990.
links: E. Friedman, Illustration of small graphs
Jason Kimberley, Index of sequences counting connected k-regular simple graphs with girth at least g
Markus Meringer, GENREG: A program for Connected Regular Graphs [From _Giovanni Resta_, Feb 05 2009]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Regular Graph.
formula: a(n) = sum of the n-th row of A068934.a(n) = A165647(n) - A165648(n).This sequence is the inverse Euler transformation of A165647.
crossrefs: Regular simple graphs of any degree: this sequence (connected), A068932 (disconnected), A005176 (not necessarily connected).
Connected regular graphs of any degree with girth at least g: this sequence (g=3), A186724 (g=4), A186725 (g=5), A186726 (g=6), A186727 (g=7), A186728 (g=8), A186729 (g=9).

Connected regular simple graphs: this sequence (any degree), A068934 (triangular array); specified degree k: A002851 (k=3), A006820 (k=4), A006821 (k=5), A006822 (k=6), A014377 (k=7), A014378 (k=8), A014381 (k=9), A014382 (k=10), A014384 (k=11). - _Jason Kimberley_, Nov 03 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Terms are sums of the output from M. Meringer's genreg software. To complete a(16) it was run by _Jason Kimberley_, Sep 23 2009
a(0)=1 (due to the empty graph being vacuously connected and regular) inserted by _Jason Kimberley_, Apr 11 2012
